text: Sidi Mardoum Mosque () was a Tunisian mosque located in the north-east of the medina of Tunis. It does not exist anymore.Mohamed Belkhodja, Tārīkh maʻālim al-tawḥīd fī al-qadīm wa-fī al-Jadīd, Tunis, al-Maṭbaʻah al-Tūnisīyah, 1939, 429 p == Localization== The mosque was located in Sidi Mardoum Street in the Hara hood, near Bab Cartagena, one of the gates of the Medina that got destroyed. == Etymology== It got its name from a saint, Sidi Mardoum. == References == Category:Mosques in Tunis
title: Sidi Mardoum Mosque
